content: Please explain driving costs factors for insuring a vehicle in 2021. Quantify the impacts for several factors including: (1) driver's address (San Francisco CA, versus San Diego CA, versus Sant Louis MO), (2) car mileage (20000 miles, versus 40000 miles, versus 80000 miles), (3) model year of the vehicle (2020, versus 2014, versus 2010), (4) car model (hybrid vehicle, versus Mercedes, versus Suburban), (5) age of the driver (32, versus 42, versus 68), (6) expected mileage per year (18000 miles, versus 28000, versus 38000), (7) insurance company (most economical, versus average, versus expensive), (8) how many years a customer of the insurance company (5 years, versus 10 years, versus 20 years), (8) financing (leased, versus loan, versus cash), (9) vehicle usage (professional, versus personnel and work commute, versus purely leisure), (10) versus driving history (10 years old driving license with one misdemeanor traffic violation, versus 20 years driving license with a couple minor traffic tickets, versus 30 years driving license with immaculate traffic tickets records), (11) any discounts available for certain demography (list and evaluate any discounts what might apply) ,(12) other insurance policies contracted with the same company (none, versus 1 home owners insurance policy for the same person, several home insurance policies and car insurance policies for several members in the same family)
